attributes.action: suspend the stock exchange for a period to avoid  a run on bank and other shares etc
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In the public interest, is it not possible for the UK governeent to use its emergency powers to suspend dealings on the LSE for a period (until a viable rescue plan emerges) to avoid the mass hysteria and fall in value of shares on the exchange? If EU finance ministers would buy-in with the same plan, the panic cannot go very far?
